attributes.action: Allow use of Medicinal Cannabis for Fibromyalgia and CFS/ME on the NHS
attributes.background: Cannabis is currently a Class B substance, defined as a "drug that has no therapeutic value". I believe that to be untrue. Cannabis-based medicines are already available on the NHS to a select and lucky few.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that no one should have to suffer due to unjust laws and that everyone should have the right to access natural, safe, effective and inexpensive medicine. Fibromyalgia and CFS/ME sufferers have little chance of finding any medication to help their condition. There isn't one specific drug designed for treatment of symptoms. Drugs that are prescribed may have damaging side effects and some patients show little to no improvement after taking them.

attributes.action: Emancipation Day Bank Holiday.... First Monday in August
attributes.background: The emancipation of slavery which took place in August 1833 is celebrated across different parts of the world. Britain, who played a big part in the slave trade, but,consequently played its’ part in the emancipation of slavery has never recognised this day as an important event in our history.
attributes.additional_details:
The slave trade lasted for centuries and resulted in millions of people losing their lives. A vast amount losing their lives in horrific circumstances. Britain made vast amount of money during the slave trade and many establishments in Britain was built on the back of it.
The emancipation has left us with great people that have played a major part in the human rights campaign such as Nelson Mandela, Dr  Martin Luther King, Rosa Parks. But we also have to remember that these people wouldn’t have the voice to speak if it wasn’t for emancipation.
By having Emancipation day as a bank holiday it will make the people of  Britain more aware and understand our past history.

attributes.action: Change the law to make it illegal to use fox cage traps in an urban area.
attributes.background: Foxes are being caught in cage traps in a built up residential area where many cats roam free, clearly creating a welfare issue of any animals caught in the trap. It seems the law is morally outdated and needs to be amended to make it illegal to use this kind of device commercially.
attributes.additional_details: Foxes can live in harmony in an urban area. Living next to a business that has recently admitted to legally capturing foxes and releasing them nearby, potentially leaving Cubs to perish. Local cats could also get trapped at any time. This distressed many people on a Facebook post, clearly the current law does not address animal welfare needs or society's current view on trapping foxes, alternative deterrent methods could be used avoiding moving foxes from their environment to protect income.

attributes.action: Change the eligibility criteria of carers allowance.
attributes.background: I believe that someone who cares for someone else shouldn’t be denied by criteria from seeking other employment, studying or trying their best to continue living their lives.
attributes.additional_details: A person caring for a disabled person 35+hrs a week can apply for carers allowance (CA) provided you meet certain criteria. You can’t be under 16.  A 2010 BBC survey estimated 700k young carers who though they may care for 35hrs+ a week aren’t entitled to CA.  You can’t be in full time education or study for 21hrs a week - if you attend school, college or Uni you aren’t entitled to CA.  You can’t earn more than £120 a week. & receive CA. The system ignores care outside normal working hours.

attributes.action: Make flu jabs free for teachers
attributes.background: Flu jabs are free for a range of different people, teachers come into contact with a large number of people including children and parents. Schools often have flu outbreaks and teachers end up having to take time off due to sickness. This could be prevented if flu jabs were provided.

attributes.action: Allow curry houses to bring in migrant staff for minimum UK wage
attributes.background: Curry business are penalised in the UK by an unrealistic salary threshold policy of £29750.00. Staff shortages in the industry means many business are closing down. UK should allow curry business bring knowledgeable staff from abroad for practical salaries to protect small businesses.
attributes.additional_details: It is not possible to train someone local in a short time to cook at a commercial standard. Imposing an affordable salary to recruit overseas trained staff helps curry business to stay in the market. To protect from illegal workers, govt. can introduce laws requiring compulsory full-time work, limited stay, and fixed amount deposit to ensure that illegal workers return before the end of their stay. Reducing illegal workers will make a large contribution to UK HM Revenue and tax.

attributes.action: We call for a total ban of all alcohol and tobacco based products in the UK
attributes.background:
There is a substantial body of scientific and medical evidence to show that legalized drugs, primarily as alcohol and tobacco, are harmful and can damage people’s mental and physical health, and our wider communities.

We call for the government to ban these harmful substances.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that the legalization of Alcohol and Tobacco send the wrong message to the vast majority of people who do not take drugs, especially the young and vulnerable, and leads to widespread misuse of these drugs.

These drugs are extremely harmful to individuals and communities, and should be banned, especially as they are significantly more harmful than already illegal drugs such as Cannabis.

http://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736%2807%2960464-4/fulltext

attributes.action: Paramedic students with a first degree to get government student loans.
attributes.background:
NHS funding has stopped this year for Paramedics. It is now a self funded course. Paramedics are an Allied Health Care Profession. 
However unlike other health care professions you cannot get government student finance to cover your course fees, if you have a first degree.
attributes.additional_details:
People affected by this inequality of funding, have been offered university places to study on the grounds that they have the life and education to study and be excellent paramedics. 
However, unlike other allied health care professions paramedic students can not get funding if they have a degree already. If you want to study other health care professions you can get funding. This is very unfair. These students are often making sacrifices and life changes. It is being made almost impossible for us to study as paramedics. We want the same equality as others wanting to study a health care profession. 
We have unsuccessfully asked the University minister, Health and Education ministers to look into this. 
Nothing has changed. 
We have not had a good reason for this inequality.

attributes.action: Lower the age for bowel screening in England to 55.
attributes.background: Last year, I lost my role model, my best friend, and my dad. He was diagnosed with Stage 4 bowel cancer with secondary mets to his liver and lymph nodes. He was just 58 years old, had just become a grandad for the first time and had the rest of his life to live.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, the NHS provides bowel screening every 2 years from the age of 60, although evidence from Cancer Research UK shows that between 2012-2014 age-specific incidence rates of bowel cancer rise steeply from around age 50-54. The diagnosis rates are also much higher for men. The current survival rate for stage 4 bowel cancer in men is just 5% compared to stage 3 which is 65%. I truly believe that if the screening age was lowered to 55, that there would be a better chance of survival.

attributes.action: For doctors in the UK to be legally allowed to prescribe cannabis patches.
attributes.background: This petition has been started in hope that, if enough signatures are obtained, there can be a debate held in parliament to discuss allowing GPs to legally prescribe cannabis patches in the UK for those living with chronic and debilitating conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
The U.S. have been prescribing these patches for some time and the difference it makes to those with chronic and debilitating conditions is quite remarkable. It's about time that the UK government allowed products like these to be issued via prescription by doctors to help improve the quality of life for those individuals who are in a constant high level of pain 24 hours a day. Please consider signing and sharing to try get the number of signatures required.
Thankyou kindly for your support.

attributes.action: Remove legal privilege from the PHSO so police can investigate misconduct
attributes.background: The Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman has legal privilege which means that the police cannot look at their case files to investigate allegations of staff misconduct in public office. The PHSO investigates the death of our loved ones but the police have never been able to intervene.
attributes.additional_details: The PSHO should not appear to be above the law. During the investigation into the death of my son, I believe that staff didn’t do their jobs correctly which led to a flawed report and decision. I’ll never be able to know for sure however because the police are not able to investigate. This means I will  never know the truth behind my son’s death. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: A short stay disability parking pass for people urgently needing toilet access
attributes.background: 100,000’s people in the UK have bowel or bladder condition which means they urgently have to use a toilet.  Sufferers often don’t make it to a toilet in time due to not being able to park in an accessible parking spot because they do not qualify for a disabled car parking badge.
attributes.additional_details:
Sufferers would only need to use the parking pass for the time when they urgently need a toilet.  They would then be able to move their vehicle to a standard parking spot.

Having a short stay pass for those times when they suddenly need access to a toilet would significantly improve the independence & quality of life for a person living with a long term bowel or bladder condition that affects their levels of continence.

attributes.action: The Government should urge the FA not to sell Wembley
attributes.background: Please help to put a stop to Wembley, a true British Iconic Landmark, being sold.

attributes.action: Change the law: unlicensed drivers are charged with assault with a deadly weapon
attributes.background: In a recent case a young man sustained life threatening and life changing injuries after he hit by an unlicensed driver. Despite being found guilty the offender was only sentenced to two years in prison for causing serious injury by dangerous driving

attributes.action: Standardizing the work week to 4 days with a 3 day weekend.
attributes.background:
Increased productivity for business (studies show that employees working a four-day work week are more productive and happier overall); 
Cutting child care issues and costs, health problems from work related stress and an overall healthier work life balance.

attributes.action: Legalise and Licence Mace, Pepper, CS Spray for Self-Defence in the UK.
attributes.background:
At the time of writing, there have been 50 killings in 2018 and rising violent crime levels at its highest. 5.3 million violent crimes recorded last year up 14%. There were 37,443 knife crimes and 6,694 gun crime offences recorded last year.

Allow Law abiding citizens the right to carry CS/ Spray
attributes.additional_details:
CS Spray to defend against rapist. 
Allow those of the LGBTQ community to defend against violent attackers. These attack have soared by nearly 80%
Give home owners an effective means of defence from home invaders. 
Spray could be easily licenced and training available. Serial numbers applied on to the Spray cans to stop it falling into criminal hands.
Ask yourself, would you rather these criminals be running around using CS Spray on each other or using Acid, Knives and guns.
GIVE PEOPLE THE CHOICE TO DEFEND THEMSELVES

attributes.action: Hold a public inquiry into the Afghan Campaign, particularly Helmand.
attributes.background: The Iraq war started in Mar 03, ending Apr 09. 2 months later the PM announced an inquiry that took 6 yrs.  The Afghan conflict lasted 13 yrs, so a similar inquiry might last 15 yrs, meaning it might report ~30 years after the start of the conflict.  It is time for an inquiry.
attributes.additional_details:
Current UK Defence Doctrine (JDP 0-01, 5th edition),  shows the First Principle of War to be, (as it has been for years) the "Selection and Maintenance of the Aim".

Expanding into Helmand, to destroy poppies, open markets and allow girls to go to school, whilst noble, ignored this principle and the UK death toll rose from 6 to 457.

The MOD refuse, citing an ongoing training task. More evidence is on Parliament's website: https://www.parliament.uk/documents/180508%20Chair%20to%20PM%20re%20Afganistan%20with%20letter%20from%20R%20Hollington.pdf

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to vaccinate your children
attributes.background: Intentionally not vaccinating children, except in cases where there are health risks, should not be allowed. It increases the risks of infection to the child and to other children.
attributes.additional_details:
On the 20th August 2018 it was revealed by Public Health England that in the first half of 2018 there were over 800 cases of measles, almost four times as many as there were in the entirety of 2017. 

According to the NHS, 4 out of the 6 vaccinations given to 1 and 2 year olds showed decreases in immunisations which is a worrying development. 
 
France has already made immunizations a legal requirement.
 
Between 2004 and 2014 there were nearly 10,000 cases of Measles and over 81,000 cases of mumps

attributes.action: For schools to sing the national anthem
attributes.background: I believe the national anthem is a important part of our country values and traditions. I grew up hearing the song -shows great respect to our queen and monarchy. I feel there have been debates about this - I personally would not like the song to lose it's importance for our Country, Queen - God
attributes.additional_details: I believe the national anthem is a important part of our country it mentions our god - our queen and shows the world the importance of the  monarchy and the great respect we have for our country traditions and the queen and our fellow men and women who have lost their lifes for our country.This song holds a important place in England's traditions being sing at football and commonwealth games and like other countries we should sing our national anthem with pride - many share my views.

attributes.action: Make school food-growing (and self-sufficiency) part of the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: All schools have space for growing food & with innovative techniques such as vertical gardening, even edges of a playground can become an allotment. Invest in schools so that they can REDUCE external dependency. Off-grid futures would incl. energy generation, rain-water harvesting & recycling.
attributes.additional_details:
The larger the space available, the larger the impact on education, health & school finances. It's also time to consider deleting meat from school meals, instead invest in growing fruit & veg.

Growing minds, building healthy futures, teaching valuable life-skills, helping children embrace the outdoors - growing food at school & learning about sustainability is fun, engaging & unforgettable, an essential subject for the National Curriculum.

attributes.action: UK Government to be responsible for planning that affects historic environment
attributes.background: Local councils do not have the necessary expertise to make planning decisions when the historic environment is at stake. The UK Government should take back responsibility for these decisions from local councils, to protect the integrity of historical and cultural sites.
attributes.additional_details: The NPPF fails to protect the integrity of historical and cultural sites. Planners lack the wisdom to appreciate them. These problems are far-reaching and threaten the destruction of our historic environment as well as the squandering of tax payers’ money.

attributes.action: Ban all gambling advertising on TV
attributes.background: Problem gambling cost this country up to 1.2 billion pounds per year according to official figures. It is also linked to mental health and homelessness. Along with smoking gambling adverts do not belong on the television. Many gambling adverts promote it as glamorous - this is highly irresponsible.

attributes.action: Allow women to breastfeed anywhere in the House of Commons
attributes.background: In the chamber of the House of Commons, women cannot breastfeed. The law allows women to breastfeed anywhere, so the House of Commons should be no exception - it's a bad example when the UK has low breastfeeding rates. It discriminates against MPs who breastfeed and against their constituents.

attributes.action: Establish a United Kingdom Biometric Identification System for all UK citizens.
attributes.background:
Identity for health emergency, retrieval of relevant health records. 
Access to state provision of health care and social security, voting etc 
Prevent abuse by requiring identity for all hospital visits for minors and vulnerable adults.
attributes.additional_details:
Additional info e.g. driving licences, medical alerts, National Insurance card, DBS/CRB, donor preferences, next of kin contact in case of emergency. 
Assist the UK government to protect its citizens from risks associated with terrorism, organised crime, monitoring of convicted felons, illegal immigration. 
Enable UK citizens to prove their right of access, their legitimate identity for their own needs, without the necessity to carry a physical ID card.

The UK Government will establish safeguarding laws. UK citizens would be required to prove identity at the reasonable request of an authorised civil servant.

attributes.action: Amend the 2004 Hunting Act to include a minimum age requirement for hunt riders.
attributes.background: A child witnessing a fox killed by hounds during trail hunting has a psychological impact. It can be detrimental to their mental health and wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details:
A minimum age of 16 years old for riders with trail hunts is required. The accidental but brutal killing of an animal should never be witnessed by a minor.

Trail hunts can kill foxes. Regardless of whether a hunt chases and kills foxes intentionally or by accident, this is no place for a child. Children as young as 5 or 6 ride out on hunts. They are innocent and unaware of the intent of the hounds should they get on the scent of a fox. To witness such a violent act at a young age could normalise abusive behaviour and create an acceptance of animal cruelty.

attributes.action: Make The Disability Symbol For Parking/Toilets Inclusive Of Hidden Disability
attributes.background:
Does the government feel that only wheelchair users are classed as disabled when 93% diagnosed with a hidden dissability are blue badge holders?
We propose a change of the current disabled symbol to the universal symbol of a blue circle as an adjustment to reduce prejudice discrimination and stigma
attributes.additional_details:
Most blue badge holders without obvious physical impairment who have parked in wheelchair symbol spaces have experienced animosity and prejudice by members of the public who judge them to be fraudulently taking up the space of 'disabled people' 
As a representative of the charity Epilepsy Sucks UK and mother of a son diagnosed with a severe form of epilepsy and autism who is a blue badge holder I have experienced this myself. 
I urge all with hidden disabilities to sign and state your diagnosis.

attributes.action: Incentivise the use of the river Thames as a transport mode for freight
attributes.background:
Having operated vessels on the Thames, I am saddened by the surrounding decline of practical opportunities for utilising our glorious river sustainably for freight.

We must ask government to assess whether enough resource is available for industry to thrive and prefer water transport over road.
attributes.additional_details:
Today, yet again commuters using the M25 are stranded due to a HGV freight collision closing the QEII bridge.
Whilst this may seem unrelated, our small vessels pass underneath, with nearly no other vessels in site for miles.
A free, reliable transport mode able to move thousands of tonnes a day and relieve the neighbouring roads of HGV movements.
Why is more not being done to retain the use of the waterways?  Shipyards are in decline.  Skills are in decline.  We must act, before it is too late

attributes.action: Allow the practice of euthanasia in the UK.
attributes.background: Euthanasia should be a human right for those who need and deserve the right to die. No human being deserves to suffer from an illness with no potential for recovery. It should be a choice for all critically unwell individuals if they wish to be euthanised.
attributes.additional_details:
In dire circumstances, it should be available for UK citizens to have the choice or their families to have the choice for an ill individual to die with dignity, to end suffering for the person of ill health. 
In the UK under ASPA (Animals : Scientific Procedures Act) 1986, there is a requirement to euthanise animals in order to prevent undue suffering. If this is legally viewed as a right and a requirement for mice, rats etc. why not for humans?

attributes.action: Allow parents to claim carers allowance for more than one child who receive DLA
attributes.background: I am a mother of 2 disabled children. They both are in reciept of high rate DLA and mobility. Therefore I claim carers allowance of £64.60 a week which is way below the national minimum wage. One of my children has various complex medical neeeds and is a full on 24/7 365 days a week nursing role.
attributes.additional_details: As parents and full time carers to our children, most of us can not work due to the complex nature of our children’s medical needs. Therefore I am calling on our government to enable us full time parent carers of more than one disabled child to be able to claim the £64.60 per week for each of our children who are in receipt of DLA and not just one.

attributes.action: Stop commercial reps from targeting new mothers on postnatal wards
attributes.background: As new parents, we believe it is wrong that some commercial representatives have unlimited access to enter secure NHS postnatal wards, drop in uninvited on new mothers just hours after they have given birth, and pressurise them to share their personal data in exchange for a pack of free samples.
attributes.additional_details:
We are concerned that women are not being properly informed about how their data will be used. We want to know if these invasive practices comply with the Data Protection Act 2018.

We call upon the Government to urgently review the unethical practice of allowing access to new mothers and babies, who rightly expect privacy, dignity and safety in hospital in the days following the life-changing (and often traumatic) experience of giving birth.

attributes.action: Reduce all fares on Govia Trains by 25% until the service promised is delivered.
attributes.background: The Rail2020 plan was meant to help all those people who live outside London to have a better, more frequent and reliable service. It was promised that there would be more trains during peak times and a better service.  until the service delivers what it promised all fares should be reduced by 25%.

attributes.action: Issue guidance to make employers aware of their duties to menopausal workers.
attributes.background: To recognise and address menopause within the workplace and ensure support measures are in place, also to be aware of the impacts that it may have upon an individual and their overall health and wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details:
The impact upon an individual during the menopause can be quite disabling which can affect the biopsychosocial aspects of our lives.

If a female is not supported in the workplace they may lose their confidence, social skills, their finances and their job, the loss to an employer can be huge, this is in terms of how much experience, knowledge and skills an individual may have and are valuable assets to a company, which could be unnecessarily lost due to lack of care and support.

attributes.action: Require employers to protect employees with food allergies at work
attributes.background: The government must make a specific law making it clear that employers have a legal duty to protect employees with serious food allergies.
attributes.additional_details:
A lot of people are uneducated about food allergies and the severity of them. A work place should be a safe and comfortable environment but for many people like myself this lack of knowledge means these foods may be brought in, causing a risk of anaphylaxis, a life-threatening condition.
 
Employers should ensure staff are creating a safe environment for their colleagues and this includes not consuming foods that others have severe allergies too, this can be done by educating people on allergies and anaphylaxis. I have been working for a company for 5 years and still have colleagues who eat nuts around me causing me to go in to anaphylactic shock.

attributes.action: Raise concerns with the French Government regards concert on Sword beach
attributes.background: Prevent / reconsider "The International Concert for Freedom" being on held on Sword beach in Normandy; A recognised scene of Battle on D-Day 1944. A location where veterans / families return to pay respects, the remains of former veterans (Ashes) are laid and where the fallen remain.
attributes.additional_details: On the 6th June 2019, the 75th commemorations of the Normandy landings. It is proposed by the Ouistreham commune , the Calvados department in Normandy with the organisers of "The International Concert for Freedom" to hold a concert under the guise of a commemorative event. On the beaches designated Sword beach on D-Day. The organisers predict 1 million guests. This petition is to prevent the concert been held on this sensitive area /scene of battle and reconsider its location.

attributes.action: Require dog friendly or dog accessible stiles on every public footpath
attributes.background:
The law doesn’t require stiles to be ‘dog friendly’ as it’s the dog’s keeper who has the right of passage. 
A dog is a natural accompaniment to walkers which is recognised by land owners/ councils when signs such as ‘dog on leash’ are used but dogs are not accommodated when it comes to stiles.
attributes.additional_details: How many dog owners have had to carry their 5stone plus dog over a stile??? We need this change in the law as we are being encouraged to get out into the countryside and see more of our beautiful country

attributes.action: Stop Fracking in the UK
attributes.background: For years, communities have opposed fracking for environmental and health reasons which were dismissed as scaremongering.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/aug/22/uk-fracking-push-could-fuel-global-plastics-crisis-say-campaigners 
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/aug/02/buried-uk-government-report-finds-fracking-increases-air-pollution

attributes.action: Force all Govia Rail Franchises to freeze ticket prices for at least one year.
attributes.background: Since the introduction of the Govia Thameslink Rail Plan 20/20 timetable, we the long suffering commuters, have had to endure a train service not fit for purpose. There are numerous social media accounts of stranded passengers, overcrowding, and services cancelled with little or no notice.
attributes.additional_details:
Only when pressurised by the Commons Select Committee, did Govia Thameslink admit to knowing in advance, that their Rail Plan 20/20 timetable wouldn’t work. They didn’t have enough fully trained drivers or a balanced staff roster in place. 

What is unforgivable is their total disregard for their passengers, and the mental and physical distress this is causing. 

The Department of Transport should instruct Govia to freeze all ticket price increases for a period of not less than one year.

attributes.action: Bring Back the Right of Appeal to Family Visit Visa Applicants.
attributes.background:
The current system of Family Visit Visas is utterly unfair.

a) When one applies for a Family visit Visa & Visa is refused no right of appeal is given. 
b) Decisions are no longer made at the respective Embassies in the country which avoids the face to face interview.
attributes.additional_details:
The system is utterly unfair. Entry Clearance Officers' decisions are poor yet can not be challenged. British citizens & UK residents in the UK are denied spending time with their family members. Refusal letters start: "I recognise that family visits are important" followed by poor arguments & decisions, overlooking facts & evidence in front of ECOs.

Bringing Back the Right of Appeal to Family Visit Visa Applicants would be the best course of action to avoid this appalling abuse.

attributes.action: Have all children educated in co-ed, non-faith schools.
attributes.background: Damian Hinds is expanding faith schools. Instead of breaking down barriers & encouraging a harmonious, co-ed, non-faith education system for ALL (like the real world), he is creating more barriers. We need respect, understanding & tolerance whether religious on non-religious.SAY NO TO FAITH SCHOOLS.

attributes.action: Change law & sentences for child sex offenders and rapists.  children under 18
attributes.background: I have recently looked into many child rape cases, and found when an offender is convicted that they may get a life sentence, and serve only 10 to 15 years of the term and be eligible for parole before the sentence term ends. I would like to have this sentence changed.
attributes.additional_details: Life meaning life to any child sex offenders with no parole and a life meaning life sentence not to be walking the streets again.

attributes.action: Official apology to the Polish nation for UK actions at the Yalta conference
attributes.background: The apology should recognise British's abandonment of the Polish nation and 200,000 troops of the Polish Armed Forces serving under the high command of the British Army during the conference in Yalta. The UK left Poland and Poles to the grip of Soviet tyranny.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom failed to meet their diplomatic, military and moral obligations with respect to the Polish nation during the prelude to and aftermath of WWII. At Yalta, Churchill agreed that Stalin should keep the Soviet gains in Poland and that tens of thousands of veteran Polish troops under British command should lose their Kresy homes to the Soviet Union. In reaction, thirty officers and men from the II Corps committed suicide. Only 25 MPs at that time voted against Churchill plan!

attributes.action: Create a veteran status with special benefits
attributes.background:
These benefits are to include: 
A higher tier housing allowance and priority over available homes. 
Food and amenities monthly allowance. 
Free public transport. 
0% Tax on PAYE or anything purchased in the UK. 
0.00 to be paid in council tax upon receiving Veteran status.
attributes.additional_details: Also investment by the government for Veteran communities in the UK, where Veterans can live and support each other, with access to Veteran medical and Dental care, Care workers for the elderly and counselling which is required to have a mandatory 6 monthly or yearly check-up.

attributes.action: Undertake a thorough investigation into Northern (Rail) and their conduct
attributes.background:
Northern, in the views of many, fail to perform in almost every respect. 

Trains are regularly cancelled, delayed or don't have enough carriages. 

Their performance makes commuting and public transport in the north a misery and has huge implications on the economy and daily lives of millions.

attributes.action: Seek an Independent Inquiry into the death of Kishni Mahay
attributes.background: For the last 29 years our family have vigorously believed that a gross injustice has reigned over my mother’s death. An unbiased Independent inquiry would conclusively reveal justice and bring Kishni Mahay dignity in death. She will be able to rest in peace and we can achieve the closure we yearn.
attributes.additional_details: Kishni Mahay was killed by a police patrol car. We believe that the car was not being driven appropriately according to the road conditions. We believe that key facts were missed by the investigating team (Police Complaints Authority: PCA). The Police Officer was never prosecuted. The post mortem examination declared that Kishni Mahay was an alcoholic with Cirrhosis of the Liver, which may have confused the inquest jurors.

attributes.action: Stop anti-abortion campaigners from protesting outside hospitals
attributes.background: Every day, women in the UK face the hard decision to terminate a pregnancy. If this wasn’t already difficult enough, the prospect of “pro-life” campaigners picketing outside the hospital, sometimes can be enough to prohibit women from accessing the care they need due to shame, embarrassment or guilt
attributes.additional_details:
In a country where abortion is legal, why do we allow the “passive harrassment” of pro-life campaigners outside of hospital and health care settings.

Everyone is allowed to have their opinion and protest for what they believe in, but this should be nowhere near a hospital, where people are facing these heartbreaking decisions. It is inappropriate and immoral. Please help us change this, so women in the UK will not be forced to take dangerous actions to terminate pregnancy.

attributes.action: Bring in a 3 day cooling off period when buying an animal from a pet shop.
attributes.background: At the moment you can walk into a pet shop and buy any pet. Some stores will offer advice for how to look after them but this does not stop impulse buying of animals. Making people wait 3 days would give them chance to think properly about whether they are making the right decision in buying a pet.
attributes.additional_details:
Quote from the RSPCA website about Rabbits, “In 2017, we investigated 2,428 complaints of neglect about rabbits and more than 2,000 bunnies were rescued by us last year.” 
If people were sent home for three days after choosing any pet, for example a rabbit, with all the relevant information on care and costs over its life time then the purchase would hopefully be better planned for. This would then hopefully lead to less animals being abandoned. Pets should not be an impulse buy.

attributes.action: Make the use of single-use black plastic for food packaging illegal by 2020
attributes.background: Black plastic is widely used in food packaging and it cannot be recycled in most places.  There are viable alternatives readily available.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of natural cotton bedding for small animals as it is highly unsafe.
attributes.background: Natural Cotton bedding has been the cause of at least 6 hamster deaths in the last 4 weeks that I personally know of. Deaths are caused by Entanglement and suffocation due to the fibres blocking access to the airways in the throat.  This is a priority issue amongst hamster owners.
attributes.additional_details: You can check hamster central forums and any face book hamster group for evidence and heart wrenching accounts from owners who have awoken to find their hamsters passed on due to entanglement or suffocation.  I have read two accounts of new owners struggling to try and save their hamsters from suffocating as the bedding had lodged in the throat, sadly they were unsuccessful.

attributes.action: To provide acceptable levels of border control staff & e-gates at UK airports
attributes.background: Visitors & UK residents arrive at UK airports to face queues of over two hours to enter the UK.  They face unmanned desks and e-gates closed or not working.  Visitors arriving to do business, invest or spend on holiday are given an appalling experience that is unacceptable
attributes.additional_details: It is understood that the government has not been prepared to invest in the e-gates or manning of Border Force desks, leaving airports, airlines and ultimately the public to either pick up the bill or leave the facilities empty resulting in queues and unhappy investors in the UK economy.  Border Force must be properly funded, properly managed and a credit to the UK.  First impressions are lasting impressions, a two hour queue is the latter.

attributes.action: Make the teaching of sexual consent compulsory in schools and universities
attributes.background: At a UK university, students were suspended for a group chat containing jokes about rape, racism and violence; it has highlighted how prevalent rape culture is within our society. Students should be taught about these issues in order to make the school and university environment a lot safer.
attributes.additional_details: Still in 2018, people do not know what consent is, as a lot of actions come under the umbrella of 'sexual harassment'. People think they know what consent is but we must be reminded about the complexities of it. We must protect the most vulnerable in society and this is the perfect way to start. Students should be taught about these issues in order to prevent something like this happening again.
